feasts: The Consecration of the church of St. Leontius of Tripoli.
The Martyrdom of St. Qozman El-Tahawy and his companions.
The Consecration of the church of St. Abe-Fam (Epipham) the soldier.
1 Paona.summary: Commemorates the consecration of St. Leontius' church in Tripoli, where his body was venerated after martyrdom. St. Qozman El-Tahawy and companions were martyred. St. Abe-Fam, a soldier from Oseem, was martyred under Diocletian, with churches built in his name in Tema and Oseem.

feasts: The Commemoration of the Appearance of the Bodies of St. John the Baptist and Elisha the Prophet.
The Departure of Pope Yoannis the Eighteenth, the 107th. Pope of Alexandria.
2 Paona.summary: Celebrates the appearance of St. John the Baptist and Elisha's bodies in Alexandria, saved from burning by believers. Pope Yoannis XVIII, a monk from El-Fayyoum, served as the 107th Pope, defending Coptic Orthodoxy against Roman Catholic influence.

feasts: The Construction of the first church of St. George in the cities of Birma and Beer Maa (Water Well) in the Oases.
The Departure of St. Martha of Egypt.
The Martyrdom of St. Alladius the Bishop.
The Departure of Pope Cosmas, the 44th Patriarch.
The Departure of St. Abraam, bishop of El-Fayyoum.
3 Paona.summary: Marks the building of St. George churches in Birma and Beer Maa. St. Martha, a repentant ascetic, died after 25 years in a convent. St. Alladius, a bishop, was martyred under Julian. Pope Cosmas I and Bishop Abraam of El-Fayyoum also departed.

feasts: The Martyrdom of St. Shenousi (Sanusi).
The Martyrdom of Saint Anba Amoun and the Righteous Sophia.
The Martyrdom of John of Herakleia.
The Departure of St. Aba-Hour.
The Departure of Pope Yoannis the Eighth (80th Patriarch).
4 Paona.summary: St. Shenousi, a shepherd, and St. Mariam were martyred for their faith. Sts. Anba Amoun, Sophia, and John of Herakleia were also martyred. St. Aba-Hour and Pope Yoannis VIII, who faced Christian persecution, departed.

feasts: The Departure of St. James of the East.
The Martyrdom of Sts. Anba Bshay (Ebsoy) and Anba Botros (Peter).
The Commemoration of the Consecration of the church of St. Boctor (Victor) in the region of Sho.
5 Paona.summary: St. James of the East, a confessor, died after prophesying Emperor Valens' death. Sts. Anba Bshay and Botros were martyred, with relics in Sedfah. The church of St. Boctor in Sho was consecrated.

feasts: The Martyrdom of St. Theodore the Monk
6 Paona.summary: St. Theodore, a monk from Alexandria, was martyred under an Arian patriarch for defending Orthodoxy, his body torn by horses.

feasts: The Martyrdom of St. Abaskhiroun the Soldier
7 Paona.summary: St. Abaskhiroun, a soldier from Qalin, was martyred under Diocletian for rejecting idolatry, surviving poison and receiving the crown of martyrdom.

feasts: The Commemoration of the Consecration of the Church of the Virgin Lady known as El-Mahammah.
The Commemoration of St. Tamada and her children, and Armenius and his mother.
The Martyrdom of George (Girgis) the new martyr.
8 Paona.summary: Commemorates the consecration of the Virgin's church in El-Mahammah. St. Tamada, her children, Armenius, and his mother are remembered. George, a convert from Islam, was martyred in 1387 A.D.

feasts: The Departure of Samuel the Prophet.
The Martyrdom of St. Lucilianus and four others with him.
The Relocation of the Relics of St. Mercurius to Cairo.
9 Paona.summary: Samuel the Prophet, who anointed Saul and David, departed. St. Lucilianus and four others were martyred under Aurelianus. St. Mercurius' relics were moved to Cairo.

feasts: The Martyrdom of St. Dabamon.
The Commemoration of the Closing of the Pagan Temples and Opening of the Churches.
The Departure of St. Yoannis the 16th, the 103rd Pope of Alexandria.
The Enthronement of Pope Demitrius the Second, the 111th Patriarch of Alexandria.
10 Paona.summary: St. Dabamon was martyred after rejecting idolatry. Pagan temples were closed by Constantine's Edict. Pope Yoannis XVI, a restorer of monasteries, and Pope Demitrius II, who attended the Suez Canal opening, are commemorated.

feasts: The Martyrdom of St. Claudius.
The Commemoration of the Consecration of the Altar of the Forty Martyrs in Alexandria.
11 Paona.summary: St. Claudius was martyred for his faith. The altar of the Forty Martyrs in Alexandria was consecrated.

feasts: The Departure of Elisha, the Prophet
20 Paona.summary: Elisha, Elijah's disciple, departed after performing miracles, including healing Naaman and raising the dead.

feasts: The Commemoration of the First Church for The Virgin Mary in the city of Philippi.
The Martyrdom of St. Timothy of Memphis (El-Masry).
The Departure of St. Cedron (Kardonos), the Fourth Patriarch of Alexandria.
21 Paona.summary: Commemorates the first church of the Virgin in Philippi. St. Timothy of Memphis was martyred under Diocletian. St. Cedron, the 4th Patriarch, departed after 11 years.

feasts: The Consecration of the Church of Sts. Cosmas, Damian, Their Mother, and Brothers
22 Paona.summary: Celebrates the consecration of the church of Sts. Cosmas, Damian, their brothers, and mother Theodata, martyred under Diocletian for refusing idolatry.

feasts: The Departure of St. Abba Noub the Confessor
23 Paona.summary: St. Abba Noub, a monk exiled by Diocletian, returned after Constantine's reign, became a priest, and departed in peace.

feasts: The Martyrdom of the Great Saint Anba Moses the Black
24 Paona.summaryconde: St. Moses the Black, a former slave and robber, became a monk, led 500 brothers, and was martyred by Barbarians.

feasts: The Martyrdom of St. Jude, one of the Seventy Disciples.
The Departure of St. Peter the Fourth, 34th Pope of Alexandria.
25 Paona.summary: St. Jude, a Seventy Disciple, was martyred after preaching and healing. Pope Peter IV, ordained in 567 A.D., strengthened the Orthodox faith in exile.

feasts: The Departure of the Great Prophet Joshua Son of Nun.
The Consecration of the Church of Archangel Gabriel.
26 Paona.summary: Joshua, Moses' successor, led Israel into the Promised Land and departed at 110. The church of Archangel Gabriel in El-Fayyoum was consecrated.

feasts: The Martyrdom of St. Ananias, the Apostle.
The Martyrdom of St. Thomas of Shentalet.
27 Paona.summary: St. Ananias, bishop of Damascus, baptized Paul and was martyred. St. Thomas of Shentalet was beheaded for his faith.

feasts: The Departure of St. Theodosius, 33rd Pope of Alexandria.
The Commemoration of the Consecration of the Church of Anba Sarabamoun, Bishop of Nikios.
28 Paona.summary: Pope Theodosius, 33rd Patriarch, was exiled for rejecting Chalcedon and departed after 31 years. The church of Anba Sarabamoun was consecrated.

feasts: The Martyrdom of the Seven Ascetic Saints in Tounar Mount.
The Martyrdom of Sts. Abba Hour and his Mother Theodora.
29 Paona.summary: Seven ascetic saints in Tounar Mount were martyred after confessing Christ. Sts. Abba Hour and his mother Theodora were martyred in Alexandria.

feasts: The Nativity of St. John, the Baptist
30 Paona.summary: Celebrates the birth of St. John the Baptist, who prepared the way for Christ and baptized Him, living an ascetic life in the wilderness.
